content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: variable_label
      operator: not_matches_regex
      value: ^\s*[A-Z]\S*\s*((a|an|the|and|but|or|for|in|of|on|with|([A-Z]\S*))\s*)*$
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0359
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Title case should be used for all labels, where the first letter of every
  word is capitalized except for articles, prepositions, and conjunctions
Outcome:
  Message: Variable label is not in title case (title case means to capitalize the
    first letter of every word except for articles, prepositions, and conjunctions)
Rule Type: Variable Metadata Check
Sensitivity: Variable
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0359
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Use title case for all labels (title case means to
                  capitalize the first letter of every word except for articles, prepositions,
                  and conjunctions).
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: 3h
                Section: '2.6'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Title case should be used for all labels, where the first letter of every word is capitalized except for articles, prepositions, and conjunctions

Outcome.Message: Variable label is not in title case (title case means to capitalize the first letter of every word except for articles, prepositions, and conjunctions)

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Use title case for all labels (title case means to capitalize the first letter of every word except for articles, prepositions, and conjunctions).
